entries.content: Ask prospects why they buy from you and not competitors. Many salespeople don't know this, often incorrectly assuming it's just price.
entries.notes: Focuses on understanding true unique value from the customer's perspective.

entries.content: When asked a question by a prospect, clarify the motivation behind it before answering. Don't assume you know why they are asking.
entries.notes: Helps uncover the prospect's real concerns or underlying reasons.

entries.content: Prospect: 'Have you ever worked with an insurance company before?' Sales agent: 'What do you mean?' (Gets prospect to articulate their real concern about industry knowledge).
entries.notes: Demonstrates clarifying the motive behind an objection.

entries.content: Address the prospect's underlying concern after clarifying. Reframe the value based on your core ability (e.g., selling/problem-solving) rather than just specific industry experience.
entries.notes: Positions unique value without needing direct competitive comparison or claiming superior industry knowledge.

entries.content: Sales agent response to insurance objection: 'So you're telling me that if you genuinely believed what I did could help you sell more, we can't work together if I have no insurance experience?'
entries.notes: Forces the prospect to confront whether the stated objection (lack of industry experience) is the real barrier or if the potential value outweighs it.

entries.content: Don't need to understand the 'nichness' of every market. Everyone thinks their market is niche. Focus on the universal problem-solving skill.
entries.notes: Reinforces that core sales ability is the unique value across sectors.

entries.content: Deliberately appear to 'struggle' or 'bumble' slightly. This makes prospects more comfortable and less threatened, encouraging them to open up about their real problems.
entries.notes: Counter-intuitive technique to lower defenses and facilitate deeper discovery needed for unique value framing.

focus_area: Competitive Objections: Unique value framing without attacking others
